metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46882 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free in WebGL extensions could have led to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 107, Firefox ESR < 102.6, and Thunderbird < 102.6.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-46882` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
